item.title: Dallas 18B20 temperature sensor
item.description: The DS18B20 is a three-pin digital thermometer that provides digital temperature measurements as 9 to 12-bit packets over a single wire serial connection. Its temperature range is between -55 and 125 degrees Celcius, with excellent accuracy of 0.5 degrees between -10 and 85 degrees Celcius. It can convert a temperature to a 12 bit reading in 750ms. You can download the device datasheet from here. Required libraries to use the DS18B20 To use the temperature sensor, one must include the Arduino Library for Maxim Temperature Integrated Circuits developed by Miles Burton.

item.title: Tinkering with a Microsoft MXChip IoT DevKit
item.description: The MXChip IoT Devkit byt Microsoft is a very interesting device, loaded with sensors and promises easy setup. I followed the Microsoft tutorial to have a first look at the device, and indeed it was extremely straightforward process.
